description.en:
The 6 ECTS course takes place in spring semester, introducing altogether 10 physical methods of characterization and testing of condensed materials. The methods cover study of surfaces, composition, structure and mechanical properties of the samples being complement to the course "Characterization Methods in Materials Science, LTKT.01.001" and the last is recommended but not required before taking the current course. Current course consists of an introductory lecture, and lectures and practical work for every studied method, and of independent working. In the introductory lecture main principles of materials characterization and testing methods and the regulation of the course are shortly introduced as well as the sources where the student can obtain main and additional information about the studied methods. As for every studied method main theoretical material, giving overview of the method and equipment used in practical work and some additional information, is added to the course page in Moodle, the students have to study these materials before the seminars. In lectures safety demands connected with the use of equipment during certain practical works is introduced. Every practical work starts with short introductory of emergency regulations in the lab and students sign a list that they are instructed about that, following the practical studies and testing in groups under general direction of the course instructors.
In the course the following methods will be introduced: element mapping, profilometry, ellipsometry, Raman spectroscopy, surface microscopy, impedance and SIMS. Large scale scientific facilities for research will also be introduced.
description.et:
Kursuse math on 6EAP ja see toimub magistriõppe esimese aasta kevadsemestril. Kursus tutvustab 10-t materjalide uuringutes ja testimisel kasutatavat füüsikalist uurimismeetodit materjalide pinnaomaduste, koostise, struktuuri ja mehaaniliste omaduste määramiseks olles täienduseks kursuses "Uurimismeetodid materjaliteaduses, LTKT.01.001" käsitletule - viimane on soovitav, kuid mitte kohustuslik eelnevalt läbida. Kursus koosneb ühest sissejuhatavast loengust füüsikaliste karakteriseerimis- ja testimismeetodite aluste ja õppeaine struktuuri ning korralduse kohta, ja iseseisvast tööst, loengutest ning paraktikumist iga käsitletava meetodi jaoks. Enne seminare toimub iseseisev töö uute meetoditega teoreetiliseks tutvumiseks meetodit tutvustava ülevaate, soovitatava kirjanduse ja lisamaterjalide põhjal. Loengutes arutatakse läbi konkreetse meetodi tööprintsiibid ning meetodi rakendamiseks kasutatava aparatuuri võimalused, praktilise töö eesmärgid ning läbiviimise kord, k.a. tööohutus. Praktilised tööd toimuvad rühmatööna konkreetse ülesande lahendamiseks etteantud meetodit ja katseseadet kasutades, mille jaoks katseobjektid annab meetodit tutvustav õppejõud. Igal üliõpilasel tuleb sooritada vähemalt 7 praktilist tööd. Kursuse keskel ja lõpus on seminarid, kus üliõpilased tutvustavad kõiki kursuses käsitletud meetodeid ja oma praktiliste tööde tulemusi. Üliõpilased saavad punkte nii seminari vastuste kui prakiliste tööde ja ettekannete eduka sooritamise eest. Kursus on positiivselt sooritatud (arvestatud) kui üliõpilane on saanud vähemalt 11 punkti: 7 praktikumi ja 4 seminariettekande eest.
Kursuse jooksul tutvustatakse nelja materjalide testimise valdkonda ning eri meetodeid nii materjalide struktuuri, koostise kui ka piirpinna karakteriseerimisel.

objectives.en: Aim of the course is giving short introduction of main investigation, characterization, and testing methods applied in materials science for modern materials, of main knowledge and knowhow sources for the methods, and more closely get the feel at least in ten methods, in both theoretical and practical part, developing independent working skills within theoretical studies of the methods, and solidifying the knowledge and obtaining the first practical skills in short studies and tests carried through during practical works.
objectives.et: Eesmärgiks on anda lühiülevaade kaasaegsetest materjalide uurimise, karakteriseerimise ja testimise meetoditest, vastava teabe põhilistest allikatest ning tutvuda lähemalt vähemalt kümne meetodiga nii teoreetiliselt kui praktiliselt, arendades iseseisva töö oskusi meetodite teoreetilisel tundmaõppimisel ning kinnistades omandatud teadmisi ja omandades esmaseid praktilisi oskusi praktikumides läbiviidavates lühiuuringutes ja testides.

learning_outcomes.en: After finishing the course, a student has overview of main methods of investigation, characterization and testing of modern materials and is able to find additional information from professional literature, journals as well as from professional webpages. He/she has got theoretical basis and first practical skills in several methods applied in materials science and technology, can utilize these in research and development in materials science and -technology, can recognize the need of the use of certain methods and choose optimal from them, that is to say can resolve the problems connected with materials studies during fixed time-scale and given information is able to give rational evaluation for the questions connected with investigations and testing of materials, can present the results both orally and in writing. Also, if needed, can use the methods for resolving special problems in other fields of science and technology.
learning_outcomes.et: Kursuse läbinud üliõpilane omab ülevaadet kaasaegsete materjalide põhilistest uurimis-, karakteriseerimis- ja testimismeetoditest ja oskab leida sellekohast täiendavat informatsiooni nii erialaraamatutest kui -ajakirjadest, samuti ka asjakohastelt veebilehekülgedelt. Ta on saanud teoreetilised alused ja esmase praktilise kogemuse mitmete materjaliteaduses ja -tehnoloogias kasutatavate meetodite alal. Ta oskab neid teadmisi ja oskusi kasutada teadus- ja arendustöö tegemiseks materjaliteaduse ja materjalitehnoloogia vallas, oskab ära tunda nende meetodite kasutamise vajaduse ja neist optimaalse valida, oskab materjaliuuringutega seotud probleeme etteantud ajaraamides ja informatsiooniga kohaste uurimismeetoditega lahendada, on võimeline andma põhjendatud hinnanguid materjalide testimist ja materjaliuuringuid puudutavates küsimustes, osates tulemusi esitada nii suuliselt kui kirjalikult. Samuti oskab neid meetodeid vajadusel kasutada ka teiste valdkondade probleemide lahendamiseks.

description.et: Student presentation (15 min) about Ellipsometry and Profilometry practical works.
Student presentation (15 min) about SIMS and SEM/EDX practical works.
Student presentation (15 min) about Raman Microscopy, In situ microscopy and EIS practical works
Student presentation (15 min) about large scale scientific facilities use for materials testing.

grade_preconditions.et: Participation and completion of each of the 7 practical works and reports for each student. Presentation in each of the 4 seminars of the characterization method groups studied in the lectures.

grade_evaluation.et: Every student must defend 7 practical work reports and complete 4 seminar presentations of the characterization methods. 1 point is awarded for each.

debt_elimination.et:
Time for use the equipment for practical works is extremely limited, thus no additional practical work time can be applied. For that reason students who missed a practical work, even due to reasonable excuse, must find a way how to complete it during other scheduled practical works, preferably of the same theme.
Also the presentations in seminars must be presented at fixed dates. If a student cannot do this he/she must find another day/time when to join with other student group presenting the same theme, so that all presentations will be presented and defended during the course period.
